content.text:
[@dan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519)

I did the thing! It isn't something you can copy and paste into /settings, but if you want to test it out you can run [this branch](https://github.com/ssbc/patchbay/pull/263). I'll add some photos of the solarized light and dark themes, but this branch can now be configured to use *any* color scheme which IMO is super cool.

![solarized-dark-feed.png](&gkqgpKGMataFbsgu7aOuq4DR9lYbyPQm+l8AneUMEoQ=.sha256)

![solarized-dark-posts.png](&1hHt4Jzf33Dh3eOUllSgmlHpS8pbeIjoIBV2adP8b2U=.sha256)

![solarized-dark-profile.png](&dth6fcqUESWDkG9p7XC87vJvlDVf/1GdtxBF4pdn4Es=.sha256)

![solarized-dark-chess.png](&39+FRt412fR7l64rWevxT6TP8nlTmYkRBaA3r59OpUU=.sha256)

![solarized-light-feed.png](&PnYnEACpkXAFoynqJw/PoYGPE5OK/veXqoEu1msbtwg=.sha256)

![solarized-light-profile.png](&YDwFEw+RkulloGM3UiVI6YfDbZj1i6uovFwSGEj0jdE=.sha256)

![solarized-light-notifications.png](&Lwu1mpkJCoWpsyUNRL3j/Blz8iz6wWgjwtz3iIU8R/0=.sha256)

The neat thing (IMO) is that you can switch the theme in /settings.

**Light theme:**

```
body {
  --em: var(--base01) 
  --primary: var(--base00)
  --secondary: var(--base1)
  --highlight: var(--base2)
  --background: var(--base3)
}
```

**Dark theme:**

```
body {
  --em: var(--base1) 
  --primary: var(--base0)
  --secondary: var(--base01)
  --highlight: var(--base02)
  --background: var(--base03)
}
```

You can also set any of the colors, here are the defaults (on both themes):

```
--yellow: #b58900
--orange: #cb4b16
--red: #dc322f
--magenta: #d33682
--violet: #6c71c4
--blue: #268bd2
--cyan: #2aa198
--green: #859900
```

It's a bit experimental right now so I'm *sure* you'll find bugs, but just ping me on SSB or GitHub if you find any problems and I'll be happy to fix them up. Hope this works for you!
